Updated Task.java with printTask() method Added mark and unmark functionality to Duke.java
Completed Level-4 Refactored Task to be an abstract class Added subclasses Todo, Deadline, Event Added new response in Duke to catch non-commands
Updated test cases up to Level-4. Error with test cases failing even though EXPECTED.TXT and ACTUAL.TXT are identical. To remedy.
Updated input.txt and EXPECTED.TXT with test cases up to Level 4 Corrected runtest.bat so testing script runs correctly
Added basic error handling. Met minimal requirements for Level-5 to handle undefined commands and empty todo.
Implemented delete for Level-6
Refactored error handling using Regex
Added new test cases to include delete, and error handling
Refactor UI and command handling to use UiHandler and CommandHandler Update EXPECTED.TXT to match input
Refactor Duke, UiHandler and CommandHandler to use instance methods instead of class methods
Add Parser to parse user input. Add Command to send command from parser to CommandHandler
Add TaskList.java Refactored Duke, UiHandler and CommandHandler to use TaskList
Refactor all files into package duke Update test script to compile package duke
Edit runtest.bat
Edit runtest.bat so it works properly with package duke
Edit build.gradle Set up IDE to build and run using gradle
Add test cases for Command and CommandHandler Refactor TaskList to return reference to itself when adding and deleting tasks
Add equals() and hashcode() methods for Command Add JUnit tests for Parser
Add Level-7 Able to store TaskList in a .txt file to be loaded for later use Able unable to store done and undone task status
Add saving and restoring of task status
Complete Level-8 Refactor Deadline, Event to use LocalDateTime Add DateTimeParser Update JUnit test cases
Add JavaDocs.
Amend code to comply with coding standards.
Add find task
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke does not support searching for tasks in the task list.

It is useful to have a function to search for tasks in a large task list.

Adding a find command, corresponding to a search function, achieves this functionality.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code to fit the coding standard
Add GUI to Duke Rename UiHandler to CliHandler
Refactor Command to use Varargs
Better look for Duke
commitResults.messageBody:
The interface for Duke leaves no space between DialogBox.
There is also an awkward misalignment between the Images and Labels.

This gives the Duke GUI a cluttered look and feel.

Adding padding to the DialogBox will allow space between DialogBoxes.
Adding padding to Labels will allow space between the Label and Image
while correcting the awkward misalignment.

Let's insert padding of (top: 20, right: 0, bottom: 20, left: 0) to DialogBoxes.
Let's insert padding of (0, 10, 0, 10) to Labels.

Using Padding is preferable to using borders as we can still add custom
borders in future improvements to the GUI. This may be used to implement
UI improvements like speech bubbles, or line separators.

commitResults.messageTitle: New look for Duke and User
commitResults.messageBody:
The images for Duke and User are the default images in the tutorial.

The default images are not very appealing and not suitable for this app.
The images also remain the same regardless of the state of the app.

Lets change the images to be more appealing.
Lets also dynamically alter the user image shown depending on
how many tasks are in the current task list.

This will provide a more enjoyable experience for the end user.

commitResults.messageTitle: Complete C-NaturalDates
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke can only understand dates in a few very specific formats.

This is unintuitive for the user and many more natural dates cannot be entered.

Lets update DateTimeParser to allow Duke to understand many more datetime formats.
We add a list of acceptable dates and time formats into separate arrays.
Duke then tries to format a given input against any of those formats.
If none match, Duke combines the dates and time formats and tries to format the inputs again.

This allows us to easily add new supported date time formats in the future.

commitResults.messageTitle: Doing A-Assertions.
Complete A-Assertions Added assertions to CommandHandler, Parser and Storage. Enabled assertions in build.gradle
Implement exceptions for reaching default branch in CommandHandler and Parser.
Include comments to explain the empty catch block.
Fixed bugs with assertions in Parser
Rename DateTimeParser to DateTimeHandler
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactor DateTimeHandler to use instance methods
instead of static methods to parse an input string.

Add new case of error handling for when
user inputs a date in the correct format but does not exist.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bugs in parsing some DateTime edge cases (29 Feb, 31 Mar)
Add UX improvement
